---
title: Serratus Anterior
---


# OIAN

## Origin
1st to 9th ribs @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

## Insertion

:::{layout-ncol="3"}
### Superior Part
Scapula (costal and dorsal surfaces of superior angle)

### Intermediate Part
Scapula (costal surface of medial border) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

### Inferior Part
Scapula (costal surface of medial border and costal and dorsal surfaces of inferior angle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

:::


## Nerve
The Serratus Anterior is solely innervated by the [Long Thoracic Nerve]({{< var ref-long-thoracic-nerve.path >}}) ({{< var ref-long-thoracic-nerve.roots >}})

## Action


:::{layout-ncol="3"}
### Superior Part
Lowers the raised arm @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

### Entire Muscle
Entire muscle: draws scapula laterally forward; elevates ribs when shoulder is fixed @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

### Inferior Part
Rotates inferior angle of scapula laterally forward (allows elevation of arm above 90Â°) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

:::

# Function

The Serratus Anterior (along with the rhomboids) serves to aid in scapular stability during arm elevation @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 

![Superior View of the shoulder: You can see how the rhomboids and SA both actively stabilize the scapulothoracic joint by pulling the scapula towards the thoracic wall @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020](/The Archive/Anatomy/Muscles/Shoulder and Arm Muscles/images/Dutton fig16.2 Superior aspect of shoulder.png)
